content.title: Scheme for Upliftment of Utsavi Rangabhumi of Goa
content.department: Directorate of Art and Culture, Government of Goa
content.beneficiary: Traditional village festive theatre groups/amateur theatre groups
content.details: The “Scheme for Upliftment of Utsavi Rangabhumi of Goa” has been designed by the Directorate of Art and Culture, Government of Goa with the objective of encouraging the festival theatre of Goa which is known as “Gomantakiya Utsavi Rangabhumi”. This form of theatre has an illustrious tradition of presenting plays during festivals in the villages. Most of the renowned actors of this motherland have a history of performing their first character role on Utsavi Rangabhumi, wherein more than 1000 plays were performed on the occasion of village deities’ festivals all over Goa. The financial support and motivation from the government through this scheme could bring the festive theatre to its original glory.
benefits: Financial assistance for the production of prose play will be a maximum of ₹ 20,000/- or 75% of the actual cost, whichever is less.
Financial assistance for the production of the Sangeet play will be a maximum of ₹ 30,000/- or 75% of the actual cost, whichever is less.
The department may identify a few groups for providing directional support.
The selection committee may recommend an amount of ₹ 3,000/- to the scriptwriter for his new script if desired.
eligibility: The applicant should be traditional village festive theatre groups/amateur theatre groups.
The group should have traditions of performing their plays during the village deity festival through devasthan or village institutions.
There has to be a tradition of performing the plays at least for 25 years.
The theatre group has to perform all the roles including that of the female in the drama from the same village. No professional artist will be allowed.
Traditional theatre group from the same village has to perform the play as the tradition may be and the devasthan or village committee may certify the same.
There should be a Bank Account of the group in the Nationalized/ Scheduled Bank in order to release payment.
content.application_process: Offline. Interested applicants should visit the Directorate Of Art & Culture, Government of Goa, request a hard copy of the proforma, fill in all mandatory fields, attach required documents, and submit the application form to the ACO-II, Directorate of Art & Culture.
documents_required: Copy of registration certificate if registered.
Copy of detail Estimate Expenditure of the play production.
Play production details of playwright artist.
If the grant was sanctioned in preceding years, an Original/Copy of the Utilization Certificate may be submitted.
Bank Details (only Nationalized or scheduled bank).
Please mention the Name of the play (Drama) and attach the script.

faqs.question: What is the role of the Devasthan or village committee in certifying traditional theatre group performances?
faqs.answer: The Devasthan or village committee certifies that the traditional theatre group performs the play in accordance with local traditions and customs.

faqs.question: Is there a limit to the number of plays a theatre group can receive financial assistance for in a year?
faqs.answer: Yes, each theatre group can receive financial assistance for a maximum of one play per year.

faqs.question: What is the service standard for information approval and reimbursement under this scheme?
faqs.answer: Information about the approval of the application is provided within 45 days from the date of submission, and reimbursement is released within 95 days from the date of application receipt.

faqs.question: Who can be contacted for more information about this scheme?
faqs.answer: The designated officer for inquiries is ACO I at the Directorate of Art & Culture in Panaji, Goa. They can be reached at 0832-2404640 or through email at aco5-dac.goa@nic.in.

faqs.question: Are there any additional grants provided to scriptwriters?
faqs.answer: Yes, scriptwriters may receive an amount of Rs. 3,000 for their new script, based on the quality of the play.

faqs.question: What is the maximum financial assistance provided for the production of sangeet plays?
faqs.answer: The maximum financial assistance for the production of sangeet plays is Rs. 30,000 or 75% of the actual cost, whichever is less.

faqs.question: How often can theatre groups apply for financial assistance under this scheme?
faqs.answer: Theatre groups can apply every year, but the selection is subject to the recommendation of the selection committee and the availability of funds.

faqs.question: Are professional artists allowed to participate in these plays?
faqs.answer: No, professional artists are not allowed; all roles, including female roles, must be performed by members of the same village.

faqs.question: Is there a focus on encouraging female and child artists' participation in these plays?
faqs.answer: Yes, the scheme encourages the participation of local female artists and child artists in these plays.

faqs.question: What specific types of plays does this scheme support?
faqs.answer: The scheme supports both sangeet natak (musical plays) performances and prose plays, which are part of the festival theatre tradition in Goa.

faqs.question: Are there any measures in place to safeguard the authenticity of traditional village festive theatre?
faqs.answer: Yes, the scheme requires that traditional theatre groups perform plays in accordance with local traditions, and certification from the Devasthan or village committee is necessary to maintain authenticity.
